pros: Great staff and you get to interact with different kinds of people.
cons: Hard to advance. Low employee morale. Benefits are good. Time off is good for the most part.

pros: Flexibility on schedule, great time off around holidays, good PTO and sick time accrual, actual family vibe where all departments know each other. The health insurance is pretty good too.
cons: Often poor management, little opportunity for advancement, and pay is lacking in a big way. It is manageable when you factor in the schedule and benefits but even AD positions often underearn schoolteachers.

review_title: Good Place to work / Pay and benefits are terrible
pros: Will get experience beyond what you would at other universities Great place to cut your teeth and build your resume with panels and committees Good People and Great Students
cons: Poor Pay Scale Not often you get a raise Pay not comparable to other universities Don't care about experience only the degrees you hold

pros: Work in campus is very helpful
cons: It should be more than 10 per hour

pros: Nice environment and great people to work with.
cons: Pay rates could improve greatly...

pros: Sense of community, good place to be
cons: Pay is low, but around average for higher education

pros: Fun working with students and colleagues.
cons: Salary is not very competitive.

pros:
-flexible hours
-easy work requirement
cons: -students can be tough to deal with

pros: You are off when the schools are closed, most of the time.
cons: The pay is meager, and the respect is even less.

pros: Department support. Opportunities to teach interesting courses.
cons: Pay in various departments will vary and sometimes not for the best.

review_title: Great Campus, Great place to work, Pay is on the low end
pros:
Great Campus
Great Staff
Most Instructors/Professors care about their students and will take the time to help and work with you
cons:
Pay and Benefits
Pays less than surrounding colleges and schools system
Benefits are expensive but are good

review_title: Good place to work, easy to get stepped on and ignored by superiors.
pros: Many of the usual university benefits. Tuition waiver for 6 hours of class per semester, health insurance you wouldn't believe, and much more.
cons: Many people working at Cameron are stuck in their ways or (despite being a learning institution) refuse to learn something new themselves. Many professors are arrogant about how they talk to staff, making for a slightly toxic work environment.

pros: Coaching while getting an education
cons: The stipends+ pay for food

review_title: Great Job . . . if you can keep it
pros: Autonomy, Service, Atmosphere, Co-workers and Helping others.
cons: Weak Management, Declining profile, Damaged Industry

pros: Good benefits, holiday breaks off, good work environment, paid tuition
cons: Pay, lack of promotion opportunities,

pros: The perks if you gain full time employment balance out the mediocre pay
cons: There is really no room for promotion or growth within staff jobs

pros: not many pro's here at all
cons: not paid enough. More than enough work

job_title: ITS Student Worker in Lawton, OK
pros: You get to do home work at work while also gaining technical experience
cons: There is really no cons to working here!

pros: The university has good colleagues
cons: The university is reactive rather than proactive

pros: Worked around my class schedule.
cons: I didn’t have any problems with the office I worked in.

pros: Worked several positions at Cameron. Schedules and time off are fantastic. Benefits are excellent as well.
cons: The pay can be low but the benefits and holiday schedule makes up for it

review_title: decent to start career, pay is not much, and you get to do all sorts of stuff
pros:
-Experience in all areas of the system, do things your own way and can steer the direction of infrastructure and systems. 
- Nice college vibes, easy going atmosphere
- Perks like gym, free college courses, and to be involved on campus
- Flexible work schedules and lots of time off!
cons:
- Can get hectic with so many systems under your responsibility
- You are expected to be on top of all the applications, servers, databases, physical infrastructure, managing your subordinates which is asking too much considering you have to build everything from the physical layer to end user applications with just 2-3 people in your team
- Lack of IT knowledge of management can make it hard to convey your point across

pros: Good work environment, benefits, and a lot of actual focus on improving service and quality of education.
cons: Tiny town, very limited life outside of work. Also, lots of crime and poverty, the town really is polarized. There's still a lot of disconnect between university values, goals, and planning due to a lot of revising. There don't seem to be more (if any) tenure track positions opening.

pros:
There has been a complete  turnover in the department so its a "fresh start"

If you want to work in housing this would be a decent "first" job. Salary is $27000, furnished apartment, meal plan and $1000 summer stipend. Very long hours, rotational on call schedule, and a questionable fire alarm system.

Training wise was none existent at the time. With the new director and a change in focus training should be excellent. 

Health benefits are good.
cons: Lots of cloak of dagger behind the scenes more so than other institutions.

pros: I get to work outdoors and gain experience in range burning. Learning lab procedures through on the job training has been good for future job prospects.
cons: Being a college research assistant doesn't pay well but it's better than nothing. I would like to have more time on the job to gain more experience.

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Lawton, OK
pros:
Generally, great students. However, Cameron has an "open admissions" community college function and many students who are enrolled as two-year students have a difficult time understanding the time requirements for college-level learning. 

Depending on department, of course, support from deans and department heads.
cons:
As an instructor you teach fifteen hours of courses. Additionally, instructors work on assessment, other department duties, and university-wide committees, etc. 

Funding issues at OK schools is problematic and a continuing challenge.

job_title: Art Instructor for Children in Geronimo, OK
pros: Very great atmosphere, as it is the art-studios. The kids excelled in learning there. There is a lot of space. Art supplies was issued by the Dean of Art, I believe. All I had to do, was make sure to teach the children good curriculum in the arts. They even had good snacks to pass out for the children on break time.
cons: None, that I can think of for now.

pros: Met some very fantastic individuals both students and faculty. Learned more than I ever before I started college and traveled more than I ever did over the country as a student.
cons: Boring in the down times due to the region and area. But it could be just what I made it

pros: Great people, student-centered university. Good benefits and vacation for full-time employees.
cons: Most employees are overworked and underpaid. State education  funding keeps being cut, making it impossible to improve working conditions.

pros: Great People, Focus on improving facilities for students, faculty and staff
cons: Not alot of advancement, very few raises if any, benefits not very good, state does not prioritize education, in area that is first to loose state funding.

pros: The work was very good. I enjoyed working as a student employee. The hours were very flexible and the people are very friendly.
cons: The cons was that there was not enough money. They need to pay people more than what they work for. But other than that it was good.

review_title: Fantastic, the people are inviting as well as the job itself.
job_title: Summer Art Camp Artist in Lawton, OK
pros: Engaging actively with the children. Creating new ideas so that they are able to learn more efficiently about art and such. Great teamwork and classroom experience.
cons: Short time in between periods, however that is expected.

review_title: Cameron is a great place to work
pros: The staff in most departments is nice to work with.
cons: The pitfalls are that unless you know someone it is really hard to move up.

pros: Close contact with professors and deeper understanding of higher education
cons: It's a student job at the end of the day... Its mind numbing and you want to run with all your ideas, but you can't.

job_title: IT Helpdesk Technician in Lawton, OK
pros: Great Benefits including dental, vision, medical, teachers retirement
cons: Great place to hone and develop skills. However, there is a high rate of turnover for employees as the salary is very low

pros: comes with good perks. Great Insurance, retirement plan along with 401K, Free Gym access, library, discount on cafeteria for staff/faculty, and lot of discount around Lawton area.
cons: Salary is not that high.

pros: Great and incredible people who are very committed and dedicated. Everyone is very helpful and will be there for you anytime you need them to be there.
cons: None that I can think of

pros: Great opportunities for helping students recognize their potential to succeed.

pros: Great benefits and easy work.
cons: Unprofessional work environment. Not much room for progression. Don't take care of their employees.

pros: Good people to work with and  a nice atmosphere to work in
